Package marketplace.Handlers

Class UserHandler

java.lang.Object
marketplace.Handlers.UserHandler
public class UserHandler
extends java.lang.Object
Handler class for User object type. Handles main methods for interacting with User type. Interacts with User_Information table in database.
See Also:
User

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    UserHandler​(Client client)
    Constructor for each UserHandler, just creates an instance and sets the client connection.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserHandler

      public UserHandler​(Client client)
      Constructor for each UserHandler, just creates an instance and sets the client connection.
      Parameters:
      client - sets the connection to the server so that queries for the database can be sent.

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsers

      public java.util.List<User> getAllUsers()

    • searchUser

      public User searchUser​(java.lang.String userID) throws java.lang.Exception
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • addUser

      public void addUser​(java.lang.String userID, java.lang.String passwordHash, java.lang.String accountType, java.lang.String organisationID, java.lang.String name) throws java.lang.Exception
      Runs checks on the params and if valid, tries to add the user details to the database as a new user.
      Parameters:
      userID - is the unique user identification that is used in the database, USER_INFORMATION table.
      passwordHash - is the salted, SHA256 hash of the user's password.
      accountType - is an enum, USER or ADMIN, and decides the users access level.
      organisationID - is the unique organisation identification that is used to find that user's organisation.
      name - is the name of the user.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs in the database process and returns an error message.
      java.lang.Exception - when the param name is too short or too long.
      See Also:
      User

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser​(User user) throws java.lang.Exception
      Tries to update a user using a full User object which contains the target user's userID and the desired User values.
      Parameters:
      user - is the updated User values along with the target user's ID in order to find them in the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs in the database process and returns an error message.

    • updateUserPassword

      public void updateUserPassword​(User user, java.lang.String currentPassword, java.lang.String newPassword, java.lang.String passwordConfirmed) throws java.lang.Exception
      Tries to save a new password for a user if they input the correct current password and give a strong password.
      Parameters:
      user - is the target user with the current userID and passwordHash.
      currentPassword - is the password to be tested against the saved user passwordHash.
      newPassword - is the desired new password to be used.
      passwordConfirmed - is a confirmation of the new password.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs in the database process and returns an error message.
      java.lang.Exception - when the new password is not strong enough.
      java.lang.Exception - when the new password is not the same as the confirmed password.
      java.lang.Exception - when the new password is the same as the old password.
      java.lang.Exception - when the input current password is not correct.

    • updateUserPassword

      public void updateUserPassword​(User user) throws java.lang.Exception
      Tries to save a new user with a new passwordHash that's from the passwordHandler generatePassword method.
      Parameters:
      user - is the target user with the current userID and the updated passwordHash.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs in the database process and returns an error message.

    • userIDExists

      public boolean userIDExists​(java.lang.String userID) throws java.lang.Exception
      Tries to get a user using the input userID, returns true or false depending of if the user can be found.
      Parameters:
      userID - is the userID of the user that is being looked for.
      Returns:
      true if the user can be found and false if they can't.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs in the database process and returns an error message.

    • newUserID

      public java.lang.String newUserID() throws java.lang.Exception
      Searches the USER_INFORMATION for userID and gets the highest number following the "user", then adds one and returns the new userID string.
      Returns:
      the new userID, and if no users are found then the id is "user1".
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs in the database process and returns an error message.

    • loginUser

      public java.lang.Boolean loginUser​(java.lang.String userID, java.lang.String passwordString) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks whether the userID exists and if the provided password, when hashed, matches the password saved.
      Returns:
      true if the login details are valid and false if they are not.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs in the database process and returns an error message.
      java.lang.Exception - when the userID does not exist in the database.
      java.lang.Exception - when the passwordHash of the provided password does not match the saved passwordHash.
